symptoms_patient_terms: Gums bleed when brushing or flossing
Gums look red, puffy or tender

differentials.name: Periodontitis
clues: Loose teeth, gum pockets, bone loss

do_now: Brush gently with a soft brush twice daily (do not stop if gums bleed)
Clean between teeth daily (floss or interdental brushes)
Rinse after sugary or sticky snacks
If dentures: clean daily and remove overnight
donts: Do not ignore persistent bleeding (>2 weeks)

professional_care.name: Professional cleaning (scaling/polishing)
professional_care.what_it_does: Removes plaque and tartar above gums

professional_care.name: Deep cleaning (root planing)
professional_care.what_it_does: Cleans tartar below gums and smooths roots

professional_care.name: Periodontal surgery (advanced cases)
professional_care.what_it_does: Reduces pockets / regenerates bone where possible

urgency_modifiers.why: Diabetes increases risk; early gum care improves control
Pregnancy can increase gum bleeding—safe to clean

pediatric: Gum bleeding often due to plaque—coach brushing; consider sealants in molars
pregnancy_nursing: Pregnancy gingivitis is common; professional cleaning is safe
Use soft brush and floss daily
systemic_notes: On blood thinners: expect more bleeding but do not stop medication without doctor’s advice

references.label: WHO Oral Health – prevention and hygiene
